instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3942: What is 820-3942? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts off when track pad plugged in
threads.message:
Cleaned a little corrosion near thunderbolt ports and replaced corroded battery but all else looks okay.
Runs fine without trackpad cable plugged in, but once trackpad is plugged in it shuts down instantly or in a short amount of time. (tried new trackpad and cable)
Any ideas what to check first?
Many Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts off when track pad plugged in
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts off when track pad plugged in
threads.message: Is this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? 3492 does not exist.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts off when track pad plugged in
threads.message: wow I really botched that number, sorry about that It's <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts off when track pad plugged in
threads.message: Run internal diagnostic by holding down D key when turning on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts off when track pad plugged in
threads.message: Ran Internal Diagnostics...Came up with "There may be an issue with the power management system" Reference code PPN001.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts off when track pad plugged in
threads.message: Inspect voltage/current sensors. <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>/10 and <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>/90 also <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area. Must be corrosion somewhere.
